p: Qualitative tests for secondary metabolites in methanol extracts of L. inermis leaves revealed the presence of alkaloids, terpenoids, saponins, phenols, tannins, anthraquinones and steroids which may be responsible for the antibacterial activity demonstrated. Which is in agreement The metabolites documented are in line with previous findings [ 15] with the exception of the absence of flavonoids. L. inermis is a source of unique and valuable natural compounds that have been considered for a wide range of disease conditions as well as cosmetics [ 16].
